body_html:
I do believe that the code generation is the appropriate thing to do regardless, but yes, it will take time.

I'm not fully convinced about the value of the enum. Yes, it may help with discovery of operations, but once the code generation is in place, then that would be a better means of discovery? Note that operations can also be added at runtime (e.g., Adding a New Op), so the enum will not be sufficient.

That said, one minor change seems to be a pre-requisite for discovery whether using code generation or an enum. That would be to make TF_GetAllOpList available in the Java API, the output of which can be parsed into an OpList Java object.

I'd be happy to add that. With it you should be able to generate your own enum if you want and if after using it you still feel convinced that it is appropriate, we could discuss the possibility of merging it in.

Sound fair?

Note that operations can also be added at runtime (e.g., Adding a New Op), so the enum will not be sufficient.
That said, one minor change seems to be a pre-requisite for discovery whether using code generation or an enum. That would be to make  TF_GetAllOpList available in the Java API, the output of which can be parsed into an OpList Java object.
I'd be happy to add that. With it you should be able to generate your own enum if you want and if after using it you still feel convinced that it is appropriate, we could discuss the possibility of merging it in.
Sound fair?
body:
I do believe that the code generation is the appropriate thing to do regardless, but yes, it will take time.

I'm not fully convinced about the value of the enum. Yes, it may help with discovery of operations, but once the code generation is in place, then that would be a better means of discovery? Note that operations can also be added at runtime (e.g., [Adding a New Op](https://www.tensorflow.org/extend/adding_an_op)), so the enum will not be sufficient.

That said, one minor change seems to be a pre-requisite for discovery whether using code generation or an enum. That would be to make  [`TF_GetAllOpList`](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.1/tensorflow/c/c_api.h#L1136) available in the Java API, the output of which can be parsed into an [`OpList`](http://static.javadoc.io/org.tensorflow/proto/1.1.0/org/tensorflow/framework/OpList.html) Java object.

I'd be happy to add that. With it you should be able to generate your own enum if you want and if after using it you still feel convinced that it is appropriate, we could discuss the possibility of merging it in.

Sound fair?
